value.message:
feat(content): consolidate hotfix article and simplify estimation TOC

- Dramatically shorten and refocus hotfix article by consolidating redundant sections (~30% reduction)
  - Replaced verbose hotfix vs. patch prose with a compact comparison table
  - Moved lengthy management-system comparisons into an "Additional Resources" cards section (MoSCoW, RICE, WSJF, Value vs Effort)
  - Integrated core principles into a single "Priority Scoring Framework" block
  - Converted checklist from 15 interactive checkboxes to three compact lists for faster scanning
  - Reworked common pitfalls into compact cards with icons and colored headers for clearer visual hierarchy
  - Slimmed down key takeaways into a single alert with inline core principles

- Simplified client JS for the hotfix page
  - Removed checklist progress tracking, print functionality, and keyboard shortcuts
  - Consolidated DOMContentLoaded handlers and streamlined event listeners
  - Simplified smooth-scrolling and back-to-top behavior for smaller, more maintainable script

- Updated templates and HTML
  - Updated PUG source and compiled HTML to reflect layout, markup and styling changes
  - Updated quick-estimation article TOC: shortened labels and removed less-relevant TOC items to reduce clutter

- Add copilot consolidation summary documenting changes and rationale

feat(content): restructure "Test Driving GitHub's Spec Kit" and update site metadata - Rework article to lead with the documentation-drift thesis and AI feedback-loop solution: update TOC, headings, body copy, metrics, conclusion, and decision criteria (when to use / skip Spec Kit). - Update source PUG and generated HTML for the article (src/pug/... and docs/articles/...). - Revise SEO/OG/Twitter metadata (titles, descriptions, keywords, image alts) in articles.json / src/articles.json and generated pages. - Rename article title in sections.json and update article summary/keywords to emphasize "AI‑maintained documentation" and "zero documentation debt". - Update RSS feeds (src/rss.xml, rss.xml, articles-rss.xml, docs/articles-rss.xml) to use new title/description/pubDate and bump lastBuildDate. - Update sitemaps (src/sitemap.xml, docs/sitemap.xml) lastmod timestamps and increase changefreq/priority for the article. - Minor fixes: adjust article-stub time, remove extraneous
lines in multiple project index pages, and update several projectmechanics card link titles/descriptions. - Add copilot session notes documenting the restructure (copilot/session-2025-11-02/spec-kit-article-restructure.md).

value.message:
fix(ai): handle empty OpenAI responses, add defensive logging, relax JSON schema strictness

- ArticleServiceHelpers.cs
  - Changed json_schema.strict = true -> false for SEO and social schema to allow partial results
  - Added debug logging of raw API responses for Steps 2 & 3
  - Added checks for empty/null choices content; warn, log error via _aiLogger and return empty result objects instead of throwing
  - Log AI response/debug info and preserve existing AI interaction logging behavior

- Add diagnostics & notes
  - Add AI_EMPTY_RESPONSE_FIX.md, AI_GENERATION_FAILURE_ANALYSIS.md, SCHEMA_FIX_APPLIED.md documenting the issue, analysis, and applied fix
  - Add helper scripts: analyze-ai-logs.ps1, compare-steps.ps1, test-ai-fix.ps1 for local troubleshooting/verification

- Content / site updates
  - Add new article "Test Driving GitHub's Spec Kit" (src content, pug, html) and update articles data (src/articles.json, docs/articles.json)
  - Update sections.json to include the new article and increment article counts
  - Update RSS and projects RSS (src/rss.xml, src/articles-rss.xml, src/projects-rss.xml, docs/rss.xml, docs/articles-rss.xml) to include new item and adjust pubDate/lastBuildDate
  - Update sitemap.xml (src/docs) entries and lastmod/changefreq/priority for affected pages
  - Bump styles.css cache-bust query string across multiple projectmechanics pages and update article stub published time

This prevents JSON deserialization crashes when the API returns empty content, improves observability for debugging, and publishes new content & site metadata updates.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Add AI response logging, multi-step article generation helpers, new estimation article, and site + RSS/sitemap updates - Implement comprehensive AI response logging and multi-step AI generation helpers: - Add AiResponseLogger service (logs step interactions, sessions, errors; cleanup; retrieval APIs). - Add Generation models: SeoMetadataResult, SocialMediaResult, ConclusionResult. - Add ArticleServiceHelpers partial with 4-step generation flow (content, SEO extraction, social media, conclusion), YouTube ID extraction, synchronous wrapper and SEO statistics. - Add extensive documentation and operational guides (AI_RESPONSE_LOGGING_GUIDE.md, IMPLEMENTATION_SUMMARY.md, LOGGING_* docs, MULTI_STEP_AI_* plans). - Add verify-logging.ps1 for quick validation. - Add new article "Building a Quick Estimation Template When You Have Almost Nothing to Go On": - Add source content (src/content/*.md), pug template (src/pug/articles/...pug), generated HTML (docs/articles/...html). - Add article entry to src/articles.json and sections.json so site index and navigation include the new article. - Add article to sitemap.xml and sitemap in docs (with lastmod) and include item in articles-rss.xml / src/rss.xml. - Update site layout and styling: - Remove extra
after navbars in multiple docs pages to tighten layout. - Remove explicit
in modern layout and adjust content flow. - Update modern-styles.scss to add body padding-top (56px) to account for fixed navbar; include responsive rule. - Update RSS, sitemap and timestamps: - Add new article item to RSS feeds (src/articles-rss.xml and src/rss.xml) and update lastBuildDate. - Update sitemap.xml (docs and src) to include new article and refresh lastmod timestamps for site pages and project entries. - Add logging / deployment support content: - Add large set of supporting docs about logging configuration, Serilog fix and quick reference, and verification steps. - Add logs/ai-responses retention defaults and guidance in docs. - Minor and housekeeping: - Ensure canonical, open graph and twitter metadata present for new article. - Wire article social share button and floating LinkedIn share in article page. - Sanitize filenames and logging JSON serializer options in logger. - Add many Markdown/HTML/Pug assets and large documentation artifacts. Notes: - The commit focuses on adding robust AI logging, breaking AI article generation into smaller, more reliable steps, introducing a new article, and aligning site feeds/sitemaps/styles to support fixed-navbar layout and new content. - These changes add new services and docs; confirm DI registration for AiResponseLogger/ArticleService in Program.cs when deploying and ensure logs/ directory is excluded from version control (.gitignore).

value.message:
feat(audit): Implement comprehensive site audit system with intelligent error handling and reporting

- Consolidated multiple audit checks into a single command `npm run audit`
- Added categories for Structural Validation, SEO & Accessibility, Performance, and Code Quality
- Enhanced error handling to distinguish between critical and non-critical issues
- Improved reporting with color-coded output and categorized results
- Integrated Lighthouse CI with Windows-specific fixes for permission errors and process termination
- Created a custom Lighthouse wrapper for better error handling and reporting
- Updated package.json to include new audit command
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Fix SEO issues: H1 tag structure and canonical URL validation

- Fixed heading hierarchy in exploratory-data-analysis-eda-using-python.pug
  * Changed multiple h3 tags to h2 for proper structure (Table of Contents, EDA Process, Automating Analysis, FAQ, Summary, Glossary)
- Fixed heading hierarchy in from-features-to-outcomes.pug
  * Changed section headings from h3 to h2 (What are features?, What are outcomes?, Measurable Outcomes)
- Fixed heading hierarchy in search.pug
  * Added visually-hidden h2 tag for proper h1 > h2 > h3 structure
- Updated canonical URL validation script (validate-canonical-urls.js)
  * Added handling for directory-style slugs ending with '/' to check for index.html files
  * Now validates all 102 articles correctly instead of missing 4

✅ Canonical URLs: 102/102 validated successfully
✅ H1 Structure: Reduced from 5 problematic files to 2 (only template files remain)
✅ SEO Compliance: Addresses Bing Webmaster Tools warnings for multiple H1 tags and broken canonical URLs

- Updated PUG templates to replace Font Awesome classes with Bootstrap Icons equivalents.
- Generated a JSON report of the audit findings, saved as fontawesome-audit-report.json.
- Implemented both standalone and extended versions of the audit tool with glob support.

- Created a simplified project listing page (`projects-simple.pug`) with basic search and filter capabilities.
- Developed a detailed project view template (`project-detail.pug`) to showcase individual project information, including repository links and deployment environments.
- Enhanced the main projects page (`projects.pug`) with similar search and filter functionalities as the backup page.
- Introduced a build script (`render-project-pages.js`) to automate the rendering of project pages from JSON data, ensuring up-to-date content and SEO optimization.
- Added client-side filtering logic to dynamically display projects based on user input.
- Improved overall code structure and readability across all templates and scripts.

feat: Add Critical CSS Extraction and Implementation Tools

- Implemented Critical CSS Extractor to inline above-the-fold styles and generate non-critical CSS for deferred loading.
- Created a script to implement critical CSS in performance-optimized layouts, enhancing page load speed.
- Developed a Safe Audit Runner to handle Lighthouse permission issues and provide fallback options for audits.
- Added a Lighthouse Windows Permission Fix script to manage temp directory permissions and improve compatibility.
- Enhanced audit reporting with detailed summaries and performance metrics.

feat: add maintenance tools for SEO and performance reporting

- Implemented `apply-autofixes.mjs` to ensure canonical links in modern-layout.pug.
- Created `report-monthly.mjs` for generating monthly maintenance reports including performance metrics and SEO checks.
- Developed `seo-a11y-checks.mjs` to perform SEO and accessibility checks on the website.
- Added `seo-validation-report.js` for comprehensive validation of SEO issues across HTML files, mapping them to PUG sources.
- Introduced `ssl-expiry.ts` to check SSL certificate expiration and report days remaining.

value.message:
chore: update package.json for a11y audit logging and dependency versions

- Modified the a11y audit command to log stderr to a separate file.
- Updated `pa11y-ci` from version 4.0.0 to 4.0.1.
- Updated `webpack` from version 5.101.1 to 5.101.3.

fix: update RSS and sitemap last build dates

- Changed <lastBuildDate> in rss.xml to "Thu, 21 Aug 2025 13:22:53 GMT".
- Changed <lastmod> in sitemap.xml to "2025-08-21T13:22:53-05:00".
- Adjusted change frequency and priority for specific articles in sitemap.xml.

chore: add .npmrc to suppress deprecation warnings in CI

- Created .npmrc file to set loglevel to error and disable audit and funding prompts.

docs: add DEPRECATION-WARNINGS-RESOLUTION.md for CI warnings

- Documented the resolution for deprecation warnings related to dependencies.
- Included steps taken to suppress warnings and maintain functionality.

chore: add accessibility audit results and SSL information

- Added a11y.json with detailed accessibility audit results.
- Created a11y.stderr.log for error logging during a11y audits.
- Added ssl.json with SSL certificate validity information.
